text: Karnataka Kranti Ranga (Karnataka Revolutionary Front), also known as the Kannada Kranti Ranga was a regional political party in Karnataka, India. KKR was formed by Devaraj Urs in 1979, as a split from the Indian National Congress. It subsequently became part of what was called the Congress (Urs) and finally merged with the Janata Party. In 1983, KKR was "floated" by Sarekoppa Bangarappa, but merged with Congress before the 1990 Indian elections. ==References== Category:Defunct political parties in Karnataka Category:Political parties established in 1979 Category:1979 establishments in India Category:Political parties disestablished in 1990 Category:1990 disestablishments in India Category:Political parties in India
title: Karnataka Kranti Ranga
